text: now let's talk about R and L together in
the same word let's use girl as our
example if you watched earlier lessons
then you'll know that our can behave
like a vowel or consonant and words like
this I want you to think of our as a
vowel sound remember to make a your lips
are gently rounded with your tongue
the tip is up but it doesn't touch the
hard bump the sides of your tongue
are touching the sides of your upper
teeth and the back part of your tongue
is pulled into a tight ball now as you
move into the L sound your lips become
more relaxed the tip of the tongue goes
up and touches the hard bump and stays
there the sides of your tongue drop down
and the back part of your tongue stays
the same so try saying herb and old and
as you do so think about the changes
that changes to your lips and the
changes to your tongue oh-oh-oh-oh
remember L in the final position doesn't
have the dropping down of the tongue
it stays against the hard bump behind
your upper teeth uh-oh
now try to smoothly connect them Earl
Earl and will finally say the whole word
girl girl let's practice the sound in
other words exercise three listen and
repeat after me Carl
curl Earl girl hurl Merle pearl Shirley
twirl unfurl world
note that with the exception of Carl
which is a man's name we have the basic
earth sound and all of these names and
words also they end with a final L which
means your tongue is not dropping down
the tip of your tongue will remain
pressed against that hard bump behind
your upper front teeth the two
exceptions here are surely and world
your tongue will drop down to make the
final e in Shirley and your tongue will
drop down to make the final D sound in
world exercise for listen and repeat
after me
number one Shirley is a girl's name
- Carl hurled the rock three Merle is an
Earl for where's the largest pearl in
the world five the girl twirled a curl
around her finger
exercise five listen to the text Leonard
Leroy and Marlene went bowling Leonard
had a purple ball Leroy had an orange
ball Marlene had a maroon ball Leonard
dropped his ball on the floor he hurt
his right foot and couldn't play anymore
Leroy hurled the ball down the lane his
ball struck only one pin on the far
right Marlene bowled very well she got a
lot of strikes that means she struck all
ten pins with one ball do you need a
calculator to know which person won try
going back now to the beginning of the
text listen line by line and repeat
after me
as a final form of practice I want to
share a song with you
it's a children's song it's called row
row row your boat most Americans know
this song and have sung it many times at
least in their childhood now I don't
have a great singing voice so I've asked
my friend Susan to sing it for you I
hope you enjoy it
your boat gently down the stream merrily
merrily merrily me
life is but a dream
your boat gently down the stream merrily
merrily merrily merrily life is bad
my suggestion now is to go back and
listen to Susan sing the song several
times
learn the words and when you're ready
sing along the practice will be good for
your R sound and in general for your
pronunciation and learning the rhythm of
the English language
you
all right that's the end of our long
lesson on the R sound I hope all of this
